title: Bots in ARAM
body: Ridiculous that I get a leaverbuster penalty for going AFK in an ARAM game where 3 of my team mates were obviously bots rather than players. Thanks Riot games yet again for punishing the people that are affected by a problem rather than the problem.

replies.body:
Yeah, nah.

You can find out all about our efforts to curb botting in [this dev post](https://nexus.leagueoflegends.com/en-au/2018/10/dev-removing-cheaters-from-lol/) from October. Some cool insights in there from the Anticheat team.

> [{quoted}](name=Gehirn,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=jEWqQQQG,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-11-26T01:58:56.956+0000)

> You can find out all about our efforts to curb botting in [this dev post](https://nexus.leagueoflegends.com/en-au/2018/10/dev-removing-cheaters-from-lol/) from October. Some cool insights in there from the Anticheat team.

I can confirm, as a regular ARAM player, who often plays in off-peak times (like 7am NZ time), I almost never see bots these days.
Yeah but it sounds like OP might be stuck in that "bot hell" the article referrs to

"Good news everyone" /Professor Farnsworth (Futurama).

If you gain some levels and win some games, you won't see the bots anymore!

After thoroughly pushing bots to the brink earlier this year they seem to be making a resurgence recently. The ones you ran into were accounts created four years ago that have been sleeping, waiting to be botted ever since. The lengths they're going to in order to avoid detection are...well, they show dedication to their "craft".

I've reported this to the Anticheat team and they'll be looking into how we can further improve our detection algorithm.
